header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 67/2019 (Hajisaheb Mosin Inamdar Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01足000381足2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of C.R.No. 379/2017 suspecting applicant's involvement in the offence of pun/u/Sec. 395, 324, 323, 504, 506 of Indian Penal Code and Sec. 39, 45 of Money Lender's Act 1946.

arguments.text: 2) It is alleged that, present applicant is involved in a crime alongwith the other accused for the offences of extortion, kidnapping, voluntarily causing hurt to the complainant Sachin Chandrakant Gangawane, who allegedly lost his money and landed property.

argumentSentences.text: 2) It is alleged that, present applicant is involved in a crime alongwith the other accused for the offences of extortion, kidnapping, voluntarily causing hurt to the complainant Sachin Chandrakant Gangawane, who allegedly lost his money and landed property.

arguments.text: 3) It is contended that, the accusation against the applicant is totally false, he is innocent person and nothing to do with the offence, he has no previous criminal record, there is no nexus between the said crime, investigation of the crime has been already completed and charge足sheet has also been filed bearing R.C.C.No. 463/2017, therefore, there will be no custodial interrogation of this applicant. Hence, he prayed for anticipatory bail.

463/2017, therefore, there will be no custodial interrogation of this applicant.
Hence, he prayed for anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent, having no connection with the crime. He assured that, he will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if he is released on anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, he is permanent resident of the of Satara, ready to furnish bail by way of security of his presence before police or Court as and when required.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent, having no connection with the crime.
He assured that, he will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if he is released on anticipatory bail.
It is also argued that, he is permanent resident of the of Satara, ready to furnish bail by way of security of his presence before police or Court as and when required.

arguments.text: 5) It is submitted on behalf of the prosecution that, applicant is involved in such type of two another offences, the documents regarding transfer of property is to be seized hence prayed for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: 5) It is submitted on behalf of the prosecution that, applicant is involved in such type of two another offences, the documents regarding transfer of property is to be seized hence prayed for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 6) It appears that, charge足sheet is already filed, investigation is completed, FIR is not reflecting the direct involvement of the applicant足 accused in the alleged crime. Though his name is appearing in FIR, his role cannot be equated with the role with the role of main accused. Upon query, it is submitted that, accused is residing in Karnataka as he is cultivating the lands on lease basis. Considering the facts and the allegations against the accused, he may be granted anticipatory bail by imposing conditions. Hence, I pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: 6) It appears that, charge足sheet is already filed, investigation is completed, FIR is not reflecting the direct involvement of the applicant足 accused in the alleged crime.
Though his name is appearing in FIR, his role cannot be equated with the role with the role of main accused.
Upon query, it is submitted that, accused is residing in Karnataka as he is cultivating the lands on lease basis.
Considering the facts and the allegations against the accused, he may be granted anticipatory bail by imposing conditions.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 67 of 2019 is allowed. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant Hajisaheb Mosin Inamdar he be released on pre足arrest bail, in respect of the Crime No.379/2017 registered with Satara City Police Station on his furnishing personal bond of Rs.50,000/足 with one or more surety/ies. a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station twice in a week preferably on every Monday and Thursday in between 11:00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. till filing of supplementary charge足sheet against him. b) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicant shall make available himself and co足operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co足operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicant shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicant shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 21st February, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 67/2019 (Hajisaheb Mosin Inamdar Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01足000381足2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of C.R.No. 379/2017 suspecting applicant's involvement in the offence of pun/u/Sec. 395, 324, 323, 504, 506 of Indian Penal Code and Sec. 39, 45 of Money Lender's Act 1946. 
---background-ends---
2) It is alleged that, present applicant is involved in a crime alongwith the other accused for the offences of extortion, kidnapping, voluntarily causing hurt to the complainant Sachin Chandrakant Gangawane, who allegedly lost his money and landed property. 
---argument-ends---
3) It is contended that, the accusation against the applicant is totally false, he is innocent person and nothing to do with the offence, he has no previous criminal record, there is no nexus between the said crime, investigation of the crime has been already completed and charge足sheet has also been filed bearing R.C.C.No. 463/2017, therefore, there will be no custodial interrogation of this applicant. Hence, he prayed for anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent, having no connection with the crime. He assured that, he will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if he is released on anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, he is permanent resident of the of Satara, ready to furnish bail by way of security of his presence before police or Court as and when required. 
---argument-ends---
5) It is submitted on behalf of the prosecution that, applicant is involved in such type of two another offences, the documents regarding transfer of property is to be seized hence prayed for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
6) It appears that, charge足sheet is already filed, investigation is completed, FIR is not reflecting the direct involvement of the applicant足 accused in the alleged crime. Though his name is appearing in FIR, his role cannot be equated with the role with the role of main accused. Upon query, it is submitted that, accused is residing in Karnataka as he is cultivating the lands on lease basis. Considering the facts and the allegations against the accused, he may be granted anticipatory bail by imposing conditions. Hence, I pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 67 of 2019 is allowed. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant Hajisaheb Mosin Inamdar he be released on pre足arrest bail, in respect of the Crime No.379/2017 registered with Satara City Police Station on his furnishing personal bond of Rs.50,000/足 with one or more surety/ies. a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station twice in a week preferably on every Monday and Thursday in between 11:00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. till filing of supplementary charge足sheet against him. b) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicant shall make available himself and co足operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co足operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicant shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicant shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 21st February, 2019. Satara
